userreviews.userReview: Meh, definitely not one of my favorites.

I really enjoyed this, the romance was really good and fun.Natalie runs her family's business and is dedicated, Ry is a firefighter turned arson investigator and they meet when her warehouse is set on fire and sparks fly between them. Both of them are opposites but well suited, somehow without knowing it they fall into a relationship, with Natalie smiling more and not being so much into working and both of them scared of telling each other what they feel.I really liked how Ry grovelled and Natalie actually paid him back for his doubts.

This was one of my favourite reads from Nora Roberts. I was expecting just an okay read but ended up enjoying this one quite a bit. Many of the other lead characters from the Night Tales series could be found throughout the book and that always makes a series more fun!Ry is an arson investigator who is investigating a fire at one of the buildings Natalie Fletcher is using to start a new lingerie business. They are instantly drawn to each other but can't stand each other all at the same time. The romance comes on strong and fast but it really works in the story. There was plenty of romance, danger and steamy scenes. I loved the ending and I am looking forward to reading some more Nora soon!

I just can't stop repeating just how great this series is. You'd think that something written in the nineties wouldn't ring "right" nowadays, sounding a bit backwater at the least, but this series is just timeless.This was yet another winner with a strong, stubborn, determined female lead, and a hunky, yummy arson investigator as leading man. Throw in an arson mystery, some explosive chemistry, a visit from much-loved characters, a little twist of insecurities, and a villain you won't see coming, but is still believable...and what more can someone want.A definite keeper!
same story as the previous ones from the series
Typical good Nora. Good Characters, good story, blah blah blah. :)

Author: Nora RobertsFirst published: 1994Length: 320 pages (Large Print)Setting: Contemporary. Urbana, USA (wherever that is, Maybe Atlanta?).Sex: Infrequent, explicit.Hero: Arson investigatorHeroine: CEO of family empireThe two Night Tales stories I’ve read (so far) fit as a sort of transition book between Nora Roberts shorter romances and her lengthy romantic-suspenses. In other words, it’s a shorter version of her very enjoyable longer books.It’s a good mystery/suspense with an enjoyable romance.And a HEA.Without taking forever to get there.There are similarities to the other books in the series, with characters from them appearing and playing important relationship roles - Althea is pregnant, Deborah and Gage have a daughter, Cilla and Boyd have 3 kids and he’s a Captain. And there are similarities to Roberts’ later books (obvious one being Blue Smoke).And there’s some aggressive sex:“Silk and heat and fragrant flesh. Everything she was filled him, taunted him, tormented him. Woman, all woman. Beauty and grace and passion. Temptation and torment and triumph. All of it, all of her, obsessed him.They thrashed over the slick satin spread, groping for more.Here was fire, the bright, dangerous flash of it. It seared through him, burned, scarred, while her hands and mouth raced over him, igniting hundreds of new flames. He didn’t fight it back. For once he wanted to be consumed. With an oath, he tore at the silk and dined greedily on her flesh.His hands were rough and hard. And wonderful. She’d never felt more alive, or more desperate. She craved him, knew that sh had, on some deep level, right from the beginning.” p.154-155But it’s still enjoyable. A good read.Night Tales:Night Shift - Cilla O’Roarke and Boyd FletcherNight Shadow - Deborah O’Roarke and Gage GuthrieNightshade - Colt Nightshade and Althea GraysonNight Smoke - Natalie Fletcher and Ryan PiaseckiNight Shield - Allison Fletcher and Jonah BlackhawkNight Moves - Maggie Fitzgerald and Cliff DelaneyReferences:Author's website: http://noraroberts.com(ISBN 9780786282197)-CR-

midnight. witching hour. wait and see ...... natalie is a high powered executive in her family business and is just launching a new lingerie business. then one of warehouses goes up in flames this brings her into contact with ry, the chief fire investigator, no more needs to be said then there is a second attack and it is obvious that this is personal. who could want her out of business and why ? a short read and to be honest i was glad when it was over. it was all too obvious what was going to happen plus co-incidental and to use the adjectives of fire and smoke about their relationship ....... plus that got rather drawn out and repetitive a few of the characters i could relate to but it was not enough also why did they not try and put a trace on the call she received and also on the phone that arsonist had in his room? bev

This is a five book series so I will do one review for all five. The books are great. The characters are easy to like although at times you wonder what they are thinking. The 3rd one has an odd twist that doesn't really fit in with the series but doesn't diminish from the storyline. I would recommend all these books although not so much to be listened to as the narrator isn't the best. I almost didn't listen to the series but I'm glad I did.

Ryan Piaseki is an arson investigator. He is called in when a Fletcher Industries warehouse goes up in flames, and his eye is caught by a woman pacing up and down outside. It turns out she is the owner of the warehouse and Ryan has more than a suspicious fire to investigate.
Book 4Another cracker from Nora,her hero's and heroines are captivating,she doesn't have simpering females,their strong but sometimes vulnerable which I can relate too,brilliant.....

อ่านปี2560เป็นเล่มที่4ในชุดค่ำคืนแห่งรักค่ะ เราไม่ได้อ่านเล่มก่อนหน้านี้ ข้ามมาอ่านเล่มนี้เลย เป็นเล่มบาง โรมานซ์-สืบสวนเบาๆ ไม่หนัก ไม่เครียดมาก อ่านจบในคืนเดียวเลยค่ะพระเอกเป็นพวกพูดจาโผงผาง นิสัยดิบเถื่อน แต่กลัวความรัก กลัวการผูกมัด ยิ่งนางเอกสวย รวย(กว่า) ฉลาด เลยทำให้บอกเลิกนางเอกทั้งที่ตัวเองก็เจ็บ แต่ดีที่คิดได้เร็วมากว่าตัวเองปัญญาอ่อนที่ปฏิเสธความรักนางเอก เพราะพระเอกก็รักนางเอกมากเช่นกัน แต่ดันเกิดเหตุการณ์ไฟไหม้ที่ทำให้ทั้งคู่เกือบตายนางเอกดีค่ะ เป็นผู้ใหญ่ สวย รวย เก่ง รู้ใจตัวเองนับว่าเป็นเล่มบางที่สนุค่ะ มีตัวละครจากเล่มอื่นมาด้วย ทำให้อยากย้อนไปอ่านเรื่องของคู่อื่นๆ

Another Nora Roberts series I missed, Night Series. And again, what can I say? She writes with many twists and turns with great character development. Love her books as she usually ends all her books with a warm, fuzzy feeling. Looking forward to rest of series.
** with audible narration **

Mais um livro espetacular! Não tanto como o segundo livro, acho difícil algum chegar ao ponto espetacular que esse é, mas muito bom. É o meu segundo preferido na série.Gostei muito da relação de Ry e Natalie e a trama por trás do romance, dos incêndios nas propriedades de Natalie foi também muito boa - podia ter sido um pouco mais trabalhada mas esteve bem mesmo assim. Não acertei no criminoso, bolas!; desconfiei de uma pessoa desde que apareceu pela primeira vez e estive mesmo convencida que era ele - e não era.As cenas de fogo foram maravilhosamente (de uma forma horripilante) descritas, o terror que deve ser estar perto ou num. Ainda antes de escrever Fumo Azul, a autora já tinha andado a escrever sobre o assunto dos incêndios. :)Mais uma vez, foi tão bom rever os personagens dos livros anteriores, especialmente, mais uma vez também, Gage! Oh, Gage, Gage, meu Némesis! Tenho uma paixão por este que não imaginam. ;D ;D Foi cá um thrill quando Némesis apareceu numa cena, a impedir um suspeito de fugir a Ry.Ia para dizer que não estou a ver quem são os protagonistas do próximo e último livro, mas já fui espreitar umas coisas e é a filha de Cilla e Boyd. Olha que giro! Uma série pequena que abarca tantos anos (e mais de uma geração, assim). Bem me tinha já lembrado que seria a filha deles porque vi o nome da protagonista do 5º livro e parecia-me que era esse o nome da filha de Cilla.

I think one of the reasons I like this series isbecause each story is so diffrent from the next. Yet each story has a good amount of suspense and romance without repeating the same basic story over and over. Visiting former characters, where they now are and what they are doing is an added bonus.While the other stories are from more the police or judicial areas, this one opens up the shady world of fire and arsen.Another excellent addition to an excellent series. Kate Rudd did a terrific job portraying the different characters and bring them to life.As with all the stories in this series this one can stand on it's own but is enhanced when read in series. Note: I have had the opportunity to read a number of series. I have never come across another that is as varied yet connected as this one. Kudos Ms. Roberts.

Well, I'm amazed at how good this book is since it was originally published a while ago and I usually think her newer books are more well-written... but this one had two excellent characters with enough tension to make their coming together that much sweeter. The plot moved along at just the right pace, altho the mystery of who dunnit was a little more obvious than most. But still, it was a very satisfying read. If you haven't taken the Nora Roberts plunge, I highly recommend this one as a good starting place.

Natalie Fletcher is a woman on a mission. She has to get her business up and running, while someone seems to want to send it up in flames.Ryan Piasecki is an arson investigator. Finding himself wrapped up with Natalie Fletcher, he feels that he is the one going up in flames. Trying to keep her safe, and find out who is behind the fires in her buildings, is difficult when he finds he just wants to be with her.A nice story.

This series is part of her weird Batman-esque one, but I really like this book. Heiress/lingerie businesswoman and arson investigator! Adults being adults! This is a good Nora category if you want to read one.

Estes primeiros livros de suspense / mistério, são um excelente pronúncio da excelente escritora que a NR se iria tornar mais tarde. Adoro este estilo em o romance se mistura q.b. com o suspense e o mistério.

Ry and Natalie are the central characters in this one. Ryan is an arson investigator who meets Natalie (Boyd's sister) when her warehouse goes up in flames. As Nat is hit by the arsonist again and again, it's up to Ry to figure out who and why Nat has become a target.

Hem komik, hem duygusal, hem sinir ettirecek hemde aşık olucağım bi kitaptı. Boyd'tan sonra gönlümü çalan ikinci erkek karakterim Ryan :D Sonlara doğru saçmalasa da sevdim keretayı. Şimdi son kitapta sıra :D

I like this series because in them I find the seeds of the In Death series. It's nice to see the beginning of a thing, and know that it can be worked on, and improved on till it becomes something better.
Quick and dirty read.
Part of a really great series!
Excellent addition to the series
Excellent, I thoroughly enjoyed reading this book. The suspense, love, and relationships kept my attention, a well written book.
4th book in the Night Tales series. I liked this one. Firefighter w/ business tycoon. I'll be reading the whole series.
Sweet story. Better developed than some of hers.

description: A New York Times BestsellerHe had a reputation for being abrasive, aggressive and annoying - but if Natalie Fletcher was going to save her business, she needed arson investigator Ryan Piasecki's help. But the classy executive was used to being in control, and Ry's arrogance was infuriating . . . and oddly irresistible.
title:
Night Smoke
      
          (Night Tales #4)
